original: Johnsson, Jonias Leander, distrikts-lantmätare, Boråis, f. 10/10/82 i Ovanåker, Gävleb. 1., av Johan J. o. Ella Johnsson. G. 08 m. Lydia Ekman, d. 10. Barn: Ingrid f. 09. — Stud:ex. 04, lantmät:ex. 07, geod. ex. 11, kult:tekn. ex. 12. Auskult. 07, bitr. v. und:sökn. av Vänerns reglering 18-20, av Kgl. Maj :t förklarad behörig handlägga förrättn. enl. vattenlagen, ol. lantmät:-tj. inom Kopparb. 1. c:a tio år, distr :-lantmät. i Svenljunga distr. sed. 21. RVO.
translated: Johnsson, Jonias Leander, district surveyor, Boråis, b. 10/10/82 in Ovanåker, Gävleborg County, 1st son of Johan J. and Ella Johnsson. He married Lydia Ekman in 1908 and they had one child, Ingrid, born in 1909. Jonias completed his high school studies in 1904, followed by a degree in surveying in 1907, geodetic studies in 1911, and a degree in agricultural engineering in 1912. He worked as an assistant in the investigations of the regulations of Lake Vänern from 1918-1920, and was declared by the Royal Majestic Court to be authorized to handle legal proceedings according to the Water Act, as well as other surveying positions in the Kopparberg area for about ten years. He became a district surveyor in the Svenljunga district in 1921 and was awarded the Royal Patriotic Society’s medal (RVO).

occupation.name: Assistant in investigations of the regulations of Lake Vänern
